hackathon-description-text: Major League Hacking’s Local Hack Day hosted by GitHub is a 12 hour event on your school's campus that brings together the local hacker community to celebrate building awesome technology. Similar to a hackathon, attendees will spend the day building projects, learning new technologies, and sharing their creations over the course of a day in a relaxed and welcoming atmosphere. Whether you're a seasoned hackathon attendee or have never been to a hackathon before, MLH Local Hack Day is one of the best ways to connect with your community.
hackathon-rules: All attendees must abide by the
hackathon-description-header: MLH Local Hack Day hosted by GitHub is back for our fourth year. Build your community with an awesome 12 hours of hacking.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Local Hack Day has no global prizes! Check your event organizer to see if there will be prizes at your Local Hack Day

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Local Hack Day is about building an amazing local community. This Devpost is just to show off all the amazing projects everyone creates.
